code: @Manual{,   title = {mdd: Download mammal shapefiles of the world},   author = {Angel Luis Robles Fernandez},   year = {2023},   note = {https://github.com/alrobles/mdd, https://alrobles.github.io/mdd/}, }

what: Download mammal shapefiles of the world
title: Download mammal shapefiles of the world
text: goal mdd provide interface download manipulate spatial range maps mammals according Mammal Diversity Database taxonomy. Currently map version related MDD v1.2

title: Download mammal shapefiles of the world
text: can install development version mdd GitHub :

title: Download mammal shapefiles of the world
text: Expert geographic range maps aligned taxonomy Mammal Diversity Database (MDD) version 1.2, published 24 Sept 2020. taxonomy includes 6,485 total species, 103 considered recently extinct, 20 considered domestic extant, 6,362 considered wild extant. mapping project, 6,362 species MDD v1.2 maps. original source R package can found Original files need 10 gigabytes storage compressed format. distribution R package, decreased resolution simplifying lines polygons removing vertices tolerance 1000 meters. store files r binaries efficient manipulation using terra R package. Finally add possibility filtering polygons species order. also added geographic filter returns maps country continent. possible crop maps country leave complete ranges intersect country. order distribute package, maps stored remote cloud server. user performs query, local copy maps stored user’s computer. functions first look see maps already stored user’s computer, , downloads future reference. service managed resources, make feature notable prevent user hitting database every time user makes query way also offer faster experience generating multiple queries. map sets. Figure 1. Package outline

title: Download mammal shapefiles of the world
text: basic example shows look specific map:  can search order country:  Also can search order continent. case first time takes :
code: library(mdd) library(terra) # for plot #> Warning: package 'terra' was built under R version 4.2.3 #> terra 1.7.23 mammal <- get_mdd_map("Notoryctes caurinus") plot(mammal) library(mdd) library(terra) # for plot rodents_mexico <- get_mdd_map(Order = "Rodentia", country = "Mexico", cropCountry = TRUE) plot(rodents_mexico) library(mdd)  library(terra) # for plot rodents_NA <- get_mdd_map(Order = "Chiroptera", continent = "North America", cropCountry = TRUE) plot(rodents_NA)

title: Title — get_mdd_map
